scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of your team members, Lisa, says: 'I don't think we can meet this deadline. It's just too much work in too little time.' You responded: 'Lisa, I know it's challenging, but we can do it if we support each other and stay focused.' Now, [Monica] and [Bob] are also expressing their concerns. [Monica] looks worried and says, 'I'm afraid we're setting ourselves up for failure.' [Bob] frowns and adds, 'I agree with Monica. This is unrealistic.' You acknowledged their concerns and suggested focusing on the most critical tasks first. [Monica] sighs deeply and says, 'Even if we focus on critical tasks, this is still overwhelming.' [Bob], crossing his arms, adds, 'Yeah, we need a more practical approach.' You suggested brainstorming some immediate solutions together. [Monica] looks at you with a hint of hope, 'Okay, but where do we start?' [Bob] raises an eyebrow and mutters, 'This better be good.'
scenes.description: [Monica] and [Bob] are looking to you for a concrete starting point to tackle the project.

options.text: Let's start by listing all the tasks and assigning them based on urgency and skill sets.
options.analysis: You provided a practical approach by organizing tasks, showing good emotional detection and interpersonal balance skills.

options.text: Maybe we need to think outside the box and find innovative solutions to streamline our workflow.
options.analysis: You suggested an innovative approach, demonstrating good emotional control and communication skills, though emotional detection could be slightly improved.

options.text: I understand the pressure, but if we don't dive in and start somewhere, we'll be stuck in this loop of doubt.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the difficulty and pushed the team to take action, showing a good balance of emotional detection and social skills, though emotional regulation could be enhanced.
